result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob L Shockto was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate w/o Valid License(2nd w/in3 Yrs), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.05(3)(a).
  • Ordinance Violation - Bail Jumping. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If commitment issued for non-payment, jail time would be consecutive to any sentence defendant is currently serving.

Huber and good time allowed. Eligible for community service under 973.03(3).

Jail credit to be determined by counsel.

Per signed Stipulation and Order dated 12/14/17, the defendant is entitled to 30 days credit plus an additional 70 days credit for a total of 100 days credit.

charges.descr: Operate w/o Valid License(2nd w/in3 Yrs)

supervisions.notes: If commitment issued for non-payment, jail time would be consecutive to any sentence defendant is currently serving.

State's Settlement Recommendation

Defendant Jacob L Shockto in court with attorney Jeffery Joy.  Defendant Jacob L Shockto in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 3:08 PM. Called 15CF138, 17CF112, 15CM202, 15CM203 and 16CF94. State - resolved - 15CM202 - plead g/nc to count #1 as alleged - 30 days in FC jail, count #2 - amend to county ordinance of BJ with $1000.00 plus costs, counts #3 and #4 - DRI; on 15MC203 - plead g/nc to counts #1, #3 and #4 as alleged - on count #1 - 30 days jail - consecutive to jail time on 15CM202, $500 fine plus cost; #2 - DRI, on counts #3 and #4 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 18 months with conditions of: AODA, absolute sobriety, employment/school, 100 hours of community service, #5 - amend to county ordinance of BJ with $1000 fine; on 15CF138 - plead G to counts #1, #2, #4, #5 and #6 as alleged, #1 - 45 days in FC jail, #5 - 90 days in FC jail - concurrent to count #1, #6 - 90 days in FC jail - concurrent to counts #1 and #5, on counts #2 and #4 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 2 years - concurrent to each other, count #2 - fine of $500 plus costs, #3 - DRI, same probation conditions as other case with an additional 100 hours of community service for a total of 200 hours of community service; on 16CF94 - amend counts #1 and #2 to county ordinance of DC with motor vehicle on count #1 and county ordinance of bail jumping on count #2 - $1000 fine plus costs on each count; on  17CF112 - amend count #1 and #2 to county ordinance of resisting on count #1 and county ordinance of bail jumping on count #2 with a $1000 fine plus costs on each count, remaining counts to be DRI. Joy and Shockto agree. Shockto understands what it means for a charge to be DRI. Court - 17CF112 - dismisses and reads in counts #3, #4, and #5, amends count #1 to county ordinance of resisting an officer, pleads G, finds G; #2 - amends to county ordinance of BJ, pleads G, finds G, both have fines of $1000.00 plus costs - 60 DTP/CO (consecutive to any jail time); 16CF94 - #3, #4 and #5 - DRI; amends #1 to county ordinance of DC with motor vehicle, pleads G, finds G, amends count #2 to county ordinance of BJ, pleads G, finds G, fine of $1000 plus costs on each count - 60 DTP/CO (consecutive to any jail time); 15CF138 - #3 - DRI, pleads G to counts #1, #2, #4, #5 and #6 as alleged; 15CM203 - #2 - DRI, amends count #5 to county ordinance of BJ, pleads G, finds G, fine of $1000 plus costs - 60 DTP/CO (consecutive to any other jail time), pleads G to counts #1, #3 and #4 as alleged; 15CM202 - #3 and #4 - DRI, amend count #2 to county ordinance of BJ, pleads G, finds G, fine of $1000 plus costs  - 60 DTP/CO (consecutive to jail time), pleads G to count #1 as alleged. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Joy makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation - accounts for 130 days credit but asking Court for 10 days to analize that to see what cases it should apply to. Shockto withholds comment. Court sentences the defendant to the following: 15CM202 - #1 - 30 days in FC jail - huber and good time allowed - credit as determined later by counsel, costs - 60 DTP/CO; 15CM203 - count #1 - 30 days in FC jail - consecutive to 15CM202, $500.00 fine plus costs - 60 DTP/CO, counts #3 and #4 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 18 months with conditions of: AODA and follow thru, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, 100 hours of community service, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, costs - 60 DTP/CO; 15CF138 - #1 - 45 days in FC jail - consecutive to 15CM202 and 15CM203; #5 - 90 days in FC jail - concurrent to count #1 in this case but consecutive to 15CM203 and 15CM203; #6 - 90 days in FC jail - concurrent to counts #1 and #5 on this case but consecutive to 15CM202 and 15CM203 - all this jail is huber and good time eligible and for community service under 973.03(3), costs on each count - 60 DTP/CO; 15CF138 - counts #2 and #4 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 18 months with same conditions as other case with an additional 100 hours of community service - consecutive to other community service, costs on each count - 60 DTP/CO, submit DNA sample, credit to be determined by counsel. Adjourned at 3:38 PM.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 4, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Jacob L Shockto in court with attorney Jeffery Joy.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 15CM202, 15CF138, 16CF94, 17CF112 and 15CM203. Called 4:09 PM. State - resolution on 4 of the cases however global resolution and adjournt to 10/4 for PLEAS on all cases. Joy agrees and will resolve all cases. Court will adjourn all cases to allow for global resolution of all cases.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 4, 2017 at 02:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 28, 2017 at 01:15 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 14, 2017 at 03:45 pm.
Final status/scheduling conference on August 31, 2017 at 10:15 am.
Arrested FOSO

Defendant Jacob L Shockto not in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 11:09 AM. Called 15CF138, 15CM202, 15CM203 and 16CF94. Richard Gomez appears via video from FOSO as the poster of the defendant's bond. Attorney Hogan appears for Richard Gomez/Patricia Beauprey. Hogan states motion for bond refund to the poster(s) for stated reasons, total bond posted is $6700.00, makes argument for refund of bond due to hardship. State informs Court that the defendant has been on the run for a long time. Court asks questions of Mr. Gomez. Court makes ruling - revokes $2000.00 of the bond and can refund the balance ($4700.00) to poster and Ms. Beauprey can pick up the bond. Court continues bond on all cases and continues warrant. Adjourned at 11:17 AM.
from attorney M Hogan she will now represent the poster (RG) on the issue of bond refund and has requested a hearing date to address the issue
Bail/bond hearing on May 3, 2017 at 11:15 am.

Defendant Jacob L Shockto not in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:35 PM. Called 15CF138, 15CM202, 15CM203 and 16CF04. Stgate bleives here for refund of bond posted by Ms. Beauprey. Hogan makes statement in regards to her client asking for the bond money back. Beauprey makes statement as to why she posted for this individual. State takes no stance. Hogan makes additional comments. Court makes statement, not willing to return the bond to Ms. Beauprey but would consider giving it back to Richard Gomez if proper paperwork is filed. Denies it at this point, allows 30 days for Hogan to file appropriate paperwork otherwise money will be forfeited to the County.
for bond poster
Bail/bond hearing on March 29, 2017 at 01:15 pm.
Bail/bond hearing on February 22, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Jacob L Shockto not in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:20 AM. Called 15CF138, 15CM202, 15CM203 and 16CF94. Poster Patricia Beauprey appears to argue for her bond money back. Court reviews the file and the form that is used when posting bond. Beauprey states it is her money, can get a bank receipt stating that she withrew the money, has talked to counsel. Court instructs Ms. Beauprey how this matter will proceed. Beauprey asks for another date, two weeks
Bail/bond hearing on February 8, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Jeffery Joy in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 15CM203, 16CF94, 15CM202 and 15CF138. PB appears as she had posted bond money and is now requesting money back. Court explains procedure. PB makes statement and would like an to speak with an attorney.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for February 8, 2017 at 10:00 am.
Bail/bond hearing on January 4, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Jeffery Joy in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 15CF138, 15CM202, 15CM203 and 16CF94. Called 1:47 PM. Poster, Patricia Beaupreay has requested bond money returned to her for stated reasons and has had no contact with the defendant. Joy indicates he has been retained on all cases and has had contact with him and is on the way to court. State asks for warrant body or $100 more on each case. Court forfeits money posted, explains poster can file an objection, or surrender defendant to the sheriff. Court will set up BBH for poster to be heard on bond she posted. Court sets BBH for 1/4/16 at 10:00 AM.  Court issues warrant on each case, body or $2000. Bail/bond hearing scheduled for January 4, 2017 at 10:00 am.
for return of bond
Status conference on December 14, 2016 at 01:45 pm.
Status conference on November 30, 2016 at 02:15 pm.
arrested FOSO

Attorney Jeffery Joy in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:12 PM. Also called all traffic matters, 15CF138, 15CM202 and 15CM203. State - today is the date that was originally set for JT and was informed earlier this morning that the defendant was on his way and was in Bonduel, asks for forfeiture of any bond posted and bench warrant, body or $2,000 on each case. Joy responds - defendant has been in contact with him and knew he was to plead out today with 4 days to report after his sentencing today. Court finds G by default on all traffic matters, pay fine on all traffic matters and 60 DTP/SL, forfeits any bond posted and issues bench warrant, body or $2,000 on each case and to be held on each case until bond is posted.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial on May 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jacob L Shockto in court with attorney Jeffery Joy.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 4:18 PM. Also called 15CM203 and 15CM202, 3 traffic matters as well. Joy - not resolved - has gone over Frye with the defendant. State puts offer on the table - 15CM202  and 15CM203 - global resolution - 15CM202 - plead to count #1 as alleged with 30 days jail, consecutive to 15CM203, #2 of 15CM202 - amend to county ordinance with $1000 fine plus costs and DRI #3 and #4, 15CM203 - plead to count #1 as alleged - 30 days in jail, consecutive to 15CM202, $500 fine plus costs, plead to count #2 as alleged, counts #3, #4 and #5 would all be amended to county ordinance of BJ with $1000 fines plus costs on each, 18 months probation, 15CM138 - plead to count #1 - 45 days jail, #2, #4 and #5 - #2 - $500 fine plus costs, 2 years probation along with count #4,  #5 - 90 days jail, concurrent. Joy and Shockto agree. Court continues bond on all matters, set all matters for JT. Traffic matters will track, felony case will be #1.  Jury trial scheduled for May 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial at 03-09-2016 03:30 pm

Defendant Jacob L Shockto in court with attorney Jeffery Joy.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:51 PM. Also called 15CM202 and 15CM203. State - here for PH on 15CF138. Joy asks that after the PH and if the state prevails in the PH, to set all matters for FPT for stated reasons. State calls Deputy William Hujet. Hujet sworn in at 1:54 PM. Direct exam by State. Cross 2:06 pm. Hujet excused at 2:11 PM. Court finds probable cause that a felony may have been committed, binds over for trial. State files Information that mirrors complaint. Joy has Information, waives reading of it, will proceed to ARGN and enters NG pleas to all count. Court accepts pleas, continues bond on all cases, and sets all matters for FPT. All traffic citations will track with complaint - no notice sent on those.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 9, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
State's
Final pre-trial at 01-27-2016 01:15 pm

Defendant Jacob L Shockto in court/custody with attorney Jeffery Joy.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 9:20 AM. Called 15CF138, 15CM101, 15CM126, 15CM202, 15CM203, 15TR644, 15TR643 & 15TR645 

15CM101: Count 1 - State amends to FC ordinance of DC w/MV - $1000 plus costs. Shockto pleads G. Court accepts plea and imposes fine of $1000 plus costs, 60 DTP/CO.

15CM126: Count 1 - State amends to FC ordinance of DC. Count 2 - Dismissed, Counts 3-4 18 months probation, court costs, AODA and follow through, anger management assesment, no consumption or possession of alcohol. No entry into bars or taverns, maintain FT employment/schooling, 125 hours of Community Service. Court amends count 1 to FC ordinance of disorderly conduct. Shocto pleads guilty to count 1 as amended, court imposes fine of $300 plus costs. Take bond posted. Court dismisses count 2. Shockto pleads guilty to counts 3 & 4. Court goes over plea questionaire with defendant and finds the defendant is freely, voluntarily and inteligently entering his plea and right to trial. Court accepts plea and adjudges guilty. State asks to follow joint recommendation and makes final statement. Joy also asks to follow recommendation and makes final statement. Shockto with holds comment. Court has considered all statement from each party and sentences to the following: Counts 3 & 4 - With hold sentence and place on probation for 18 months, court costs take from money posted, AODA and follow through, anger management program and follow through with recommendations, no consumption or possession of alcohol, no entry into bars or taverns, maintain FT employment/schooling, 125 hours of community service, must obtain GED. Right to appeal, submit DNA sample. Take all money posted on each case.

15CM203, 15CM202 and 15CF138 - Joy has complaint waives further reading, waives time limints on felony case and pleads NG to all misdemeanor counts. All bonds continued.

 
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 27, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Signature bond set.
